subject: Basketball
lead_paragraph: Five Florida spring training sites are eligible to receive $15 million each over the next 30 years under a bill signed yesterday by Gov. Jeb Bush. The bill also provides the Orlando Magic with $60 million to refurbish its arena. Six baseball teams will be able to apply for the money, which would be split into $500,000 annual payments to help keep Arizona's Cactus League from raiding the Florida Grapefruit League. Baltimore, Cincinnati, Cleveland, the Mets, Pittsburgh and Tampa Bay are covered in the bill.
